intro: Cyathodes macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered cyathodes, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other similar plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences called cyathodes, which are often brightly colored to attract pollinators. Its flowers typically have five petals and are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Cyathodes macrantha is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
